alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Gove; Graham; Norton; Rawlins; Sheridan (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 10 at 2:53PM CDT until April 11 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather continue into Wednesday; Red Flag Warning Tuesday and Fire Weather Watch Wednesday... .Multiple days of warm to hot temperatures and a dry air mass is forecast to be in place, with breezy to gusty winds in place. This along with the prolonged period of antecedent warm and dry conditions will further exacerbate the fire weather concerns. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 9 PM CDT TUESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 002, 003, 004, 015, 016, 029, 080, AND 081... * Affected Area...In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 002 Rawlins, Fire Weather Zone 003 Decatur, Fire Weather Zone 004 Norton, Fire Weather Zone 015 Sheridan, Fire Weather Zone 016 Graham and Fire Weather Zone 029 Gove. In Nebraska, Fire Weather Zone 080 Hitchcock and Fire Weather Zone 081 Red Willow. * Winds...South 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 9 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are imminent. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Decatur; Gove; Graham; Norton; Rawlins; Sheridan
